document.heading: Rental Housing Registration Extension Temporary Amendment Act of 2025

To amend, on a temporary basis, section 205(f) of the Rental Housing Act of 1985 to extend the deadline from 90 days to 180 days for housing providers to file a new registration statement after the completion of the publicly accessible rent control housing database, and to require owners of rental accommodations that are exempt from rent stabilization to report current and prior rent amounts for the previous 2 calendar years at the time of registration.
document.text: BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Rental Housing Registration Extension Temporary Amendment Act of 2025".

section.text: Section 205(f) of the Rental Housing Act of 1985, effective July 17, 1985 (D.C. Law 6-10; D.C. Official Code ยง 42-3502.05(f)), is amended as follows:

para.text: Paragraph (1) is amended by striking the number "90" and inserting the number "180" in its place.
Paragraph (2) is amended by striking the number "90" and inserting the number "180" in its place.
Subparagraph (A) is amended by striking the number "90" and inserting the number "180" in its place.
Subparagraph (B)(i) is amended by striking the number "91" and inserting the number "181" in its place.
A new paragraph (5) is added to read as follows:

The owner of a rental accommodation that is exempt from rent stabilization pursuant to subsection (a) of this section shall, at the time of registration, provide the following information for each rental unit:
The current monthly rent amount; and
The monthly rent amount charged for the same unit during each of the 2 prior calendar years.
The information required under subparagraph (A) of this paragraph shall be submitted only at the time of registration and shall not be subject to any ongoing or annual reporting requirements.

section.heading: Fiscal impact statement.
section.text: The Council adopts the fiscal impact statement of the Budget Director as the fiscal impact statement required by section 4a of the General Legislative Procedures Act of 1975, approved October 16, 2006 (120 Stat. 2038; D.C. Official Code ยง 1-301.47a).

para.text: This act shall take effect following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council to override the veto) and a 30-day period of congressional review as provided in section 602(c)(1) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 813; D.C. Official Code ยง 1-206.02(c)(1)).
This act shall expire after 225 days of its having taken effect.
